title: CrowdfundBee
author: CrowdfundBee
content: Dear BitcoinTalk Community,While Bitcoin was initially presented as a revolutionary technology aimed at empowering ordinary people with financial independence, today it seems more like a tool for financial magnates rather than an instrument for the people. It appears that Bitcoin is increasingly being used as a speculative asset rather than a genuine means of improving people’s lives.When Bitcoin was first created, its goal was clear: to build a decentralized, independent financial system accessible to everyone. Today, however, Bitcoin often seems to serve as a tool for large financial players, focused more on value appreciation than on the original goal of helping ordinary people.One striking example of Satoshi Nakamoto's commitment to the idea of Bitcoin as a non-profit creation is the burning of 1 million Bitcoins. This act, in my view, demonstrated that Bitcoin was not intended to be a commercial product but rather a tool for the people, regardless of whether it would generate profit. If Bitcoin were just a financial product, it would have been illogical to destroy such a significant amount of its supply.For a long time, Bitcoin has not had a proper crowdfunding platform, a place where anyone could fund Campaigns with small iniciatives directly in a decentralized way. CrowdfundBee is an example of what could bring Bitcoin’s true purpose back to life — enabling people to fund ideas and projects without intermediaries, while remaining true to Nakamoto’s vision. While such platforms may not generate profits for the creators, this approach aligns with Satoshi Nakamoto’s original goal: to serve the people, not the profit-driven motives.It is logical to assume that Satoshi Nakamoto did not create Bitcoin as a profit-driven product — rather, he sought to create a tool that would empower people. Bitcoin, like many decentralized projects, should be about fairness, opportunity, and openness to all, not just about financial gains.Can we return to these goals and build new platforms that genuinely help the people? This is likely the greatest challenge we face today.Respectfully,Myjota dev of CrowdfundBee.xyz MVP version build.

comments.author: K_vin
comments.body: Bitcoin was created in the bid to find an alternative to paper money and a means of transaction that is totally controlled by the owner without a third party regulations or involvement, be it an individual, government or organisation, To build something that can shoulder this level of responsibility, the quantity has to be much and circulation has to be everywhere, but to a very large extent the coin failed in this regard, the quantity of btc available and in circulation is very limited, and since more and more people are liking the idea of this alternative means of transaction, more and more people are coming into the space daily thereby increasing the demand for bitcoin that is already limited in supply which directly impacted the price and the value sky rocked and some persons who have in lare and small quantities decided to hold it for longer without selling since the value will keep rising over the longer period of time thereby causing more shortage in supply and increment in price..  .so no one can blame anymore making a profits out of bitcoin as it only came natural with shortage in supply and increment in demand of bitcoin over time

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Satoshi did not "burn" his coins in the traditional sense. He simply held on to them until old age overtook him. There are plenty of people who have similarly done this sort of thing with smaller amounts of BTC, which has resulted in plenty of BTC becoming inaccessible.

comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Quote from: CrowdfundBee on February 09, 2025, 03:10:25 PMThis act, in my view, demonstrated that Bitcoin was not intended to be a commercial product but rather a tool for the people, regardless of whether it would generate profit.But it still is not a product. It's a protocol; a technology in which products can be made of it. There are a host variety of services that are sold in the market, such as exchanges, that use bitcoin, just as there are a variety of services that sell Internet related products, while the Internet is not "owned" by anyone, it's just a protocol. In fact, it's so decentralized that it uncontrollably evolved from what the creator might intended it to be.
